item.title: Medicare Keeps Getting Tougher for Health Insurers
item.description: Managed care stocks are set to fall due to disappointment with the government’s decision not to revise the 2025 Medicare payment proposal.

item.title: The New Magic Number for Retirement Is $1.46 Million. Here's What It Tells Us.
item.description: There is no single formula for how much you need to save in your 401(k).

item.title: Four Steps to Take When Spring-Cleaning Your Portfolio
item.description: Financial pros say investors should review their savings goals and strategies around tax time each year and make necessary adjustments.

item.title: Is China's Economy Finally Bottoming Out?
item.description: Recent data contains clear hints of improvement but the Fed, for one, could play spoiler.

item.title: Comments by China's Xi Hint at Possible Expansion of PBOC Toolkit
item.description: A months-old speech by China’s top leader has stoked speculation around aggressive liquidity boosts from Beijing.

item.title: Bitcoin Is Soaring This Year. Goldman's Crypto Skeptic Isn't Biting.
item.description: Sharmin Mossavar-Rahmani is known for her blunt opinions and bitcoin skepticism.

item.title: Regulator Probes BlackRock and Vanguard Over Huge Stakes in U.S. Banks
item.description: The FDIC is scrutinizing whether the index-fund giants are sticking to passive roles when it comes to their investments in U.S. banks.

item.title: Yen Intervention Risk Is Rising, but Effects Could Be Short-Lived
item.description: Traders are increasingly wary of potential intervention following recent warnings from Japanese officials as the yen weakened to 34-year lows against the dollar.

item.title: China Developers' Shares Suspended in Hong Kong
item.description: Several Chinese developers’ shares have been suspended from trading in Hong Kong due to their failure to meet the deadline for publishing last year’s annual results, another sign of the turmoil in the country’s real-estate sector.

item.title: Japan's World-Beating Stock Gains May Lose Steam
item.description: After a blistering run to record highs, Japanese stocks may be running out of catalysts in the near term.

item.title: What the 2024 Capital-Gains Tax Brackets Mean for Your Investments
item.description: How capital-gains tax rates work, depending on your income.

item.title: Standard Deduction 2023-24: What to Know This Tax Season
item.description: The standard deduction is advisable when it is greater than your total itemized deductions listed on Schedule A.

item.title: Trump Media Shares Tumble After Recent Cash Crunch Disclosed
item.description: The stock’s plunge erased more than $1 billion from Donald Trump’s approximately 57% stake in the company.

item.title: S&P 500 Drops to Start New Quarter
item.description: Fresh data raise doubts on whether the Fed will cut rates three times this year. The S&P 500 fell 0.2%, while Walgreens shares declined 9.9%.

item.title: Beat High Mortgage Rates With an Intrafamily Loan. Here's How the Taxes Work.
item.description: We answer a reader’s question about lending money to a granddaughter for a down payment on a home.

item.title: Baltimore Bridge Collapse Could Fuel Reinsurance Pricing
item.description: The cost of insuring against extreme risks has been rising, and the complexity of covering Baltimore’s tragedy may further that.

item.title: Don't Count Samsung Out in the AI Memory Stakes
item.description: Chip makers SK Hynix and Micron have gained, but Samsung’s financial and tech capacity are ready to shine.

item.title: This Disney War Has Already Paid Off
item.description: The stock price has jumped after many shareholder-friendly changes—without adding rancor to the company’s board.

item.title: Inside the Russian Shadow Trade for Weapons Parts, Fueled by Crypto
item.description: How Russian middlemen used the cryptocurrency tether to avoid U.S. sanctions and procure parts for drones and high-tech weapons.

item.title: The Stock Market's Magnificent Seven Is Now the Fab Four
item.description: Some investors say it is a bullish signal that the market is rallying without the likes of Apple and Tesla because it means other groups are taking part.
